fr.sii.ogham.core.condition.fluent

Class Conditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.condition.fluent.Conditions

  • public class Conditions
extends Object
    Helper to write fluent conditions like: 
     requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport").and(not(requiredClass("foo.Bar")));
    To do this, you need to add the following static import: 
     import static fr.sii.ogham.core.condition.fluent.Conditions.*;

    If you are using Java 7, you may need to use MessageConditions instead because Java 7 doesn't resolve correctly generics chaining.

    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • $

        public static <T> FluentCondition<T> $(Condition<T> condition)
        Parenthesis operator to handle priorities: 
         $(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.host").or(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.smtp.host")))
                .and(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.port").or(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.smtp.port")))
        Meaning "(mail.host is defined OR mail.smtp.host is defined) AND (mail.port is defined OR mail.smtp.port is defined)".

        Without this operator, you had to write this: 

         requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.host").or(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.smtp.host"))
 .and(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.port").or(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.smtp.port"))
        Meaning "mail.host is defined OR mail.smtp.host is defined AND (mail.port is defined OR mail.smtp.port is defined)". So the behavior won't be the same.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition to surround
        Returns:
        the fluent condition

      • and

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> FluentCondition<T> and(Condition<T>... conditions)
        And operator between the provided conditions: 
         and(requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport"), requiredClass("foo.Bar"));
        Means that the result will be true only if javax.mail.Transport and foo.Bar classes are present in the classpath.

        If one of the condition result is false, then other conditions are not evaluated.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        conditions - one or several conditions
        Returns:
        the fluent condition

      • and

        public static <T> FluentCondition<T> and(List<Condition<T>> conditions)
        And operator between the provided conditions. It is a helper method that is useful when you need to construct conditions separately: 
         List<Condition<Message>> conditions = new ArrayList<>();
 conditions.add(requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport"));
 conditions.add(requiredClass("foo.Bar"));
 
 and(conditions);
        Means that the result will be true only if javax.mail.Transport and foo.Bar classes are present in the classpath.

        If one of the condition result is false, then other conditions are not evaluated.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        conditions - one or several conditions
        Returns:
        the fluent condition

      • or

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> FluentCondition<T> or(Condition<T>... conditions)
        Or operator between the provided conditions: 
         or(requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport"), requiredClass("foo.Bar"));
        Means that the result will be true if either javax.mail.Transport or foo.Bar class is present in the classpath.

        If one of the condition result is true, then other conditions are not evaluated.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        conditions - one or several conditions
        Returns:
        the fluent condition

      • or

        public static <T> FluentCondition<T> or(List<Condition<T>> conditions)
        Or operator between the provided conditions. It is a helper method that is useful when you need to construct conditions separately: 
         List<Condition<Message>> conditions = new ArrayList<>();
 conditions.add(requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport"));
 conditions.add(requiredClass("foo.Bar"));
 
 or(conditions);
        Means that the result will be true if either javax.mail.Transport or foo.Bar class is present in the classpath.

        If one of the condition result is true, then other conditions are not evaluated.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        conditions - one or several conditions
        Returns:
        the fluent condition

      • not

        public static <T> FluentCondition<T> not(Condition<T> condition)
        Not operator to reverse provided condition: 
         not(requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport));
        Means that the result will be true if the class javax.mail.Transport is not present in the classpath.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition to reverse
        Returns:
        the fluent condition

      • requiredProperty

        public static <T> FluentCondition<T> requiredProperty(PropertyResolver propertyResolver,
                                                      String property)
        Check if a property is present in the configuration properties. The configuration properties are available through the property resolver. 
         requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.host");
        Means that the result will be true only if the property mail.host is present in the property resolver.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        propertyResolver - the resolver that is used to access property values
        property - the property name
        Returns:
        the fluent condition

      • requiredPropertyValue

        public static <T> FluentCondition<T> requiredPropertyValue(PropertyResolver propertyResolver,
                                                           String property,
                                                           String value)
        Check if a property has a particular value in the configuration properties. The configuration properties are available through the property resolver. 
         requiredPropertyValue(propertyResolver, "mail.host", "localhost");
        Means that the result will be true only if the property mail.host is present in the property resolver and its value is exactly localhost.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        propertyResolver - the resolver that is used to access property values
        property - the property name
        value - the exact value to match
        Returns:
        the fluent condition

      • requiredPropertyValue

        public static <T> FluentCondition<T> requiredPropertyValue(PropertyResolver propertyResolver,
                                                           String property,
                                                           Pattern pattern)
        Check if a property value matches the pattern in the configuration properties. The configuration properties are available through the property resolver. 
         requiredPropertyValue(propertyResolver, "mail.host", Pattern.compile("local.*"));
        Means that the result will be true only if the property mail.host is present in the property resolver and its value matches the pattern local.*.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        propertyResolver - the resolver that is used to access property values
        property - the property name
        pattern - the pattern used to check if the value matches
        Returns:
        the fluent condition

      • requiredClass

        public static <T> FluentCondition<T> requiredClass(String className)
        Check if a class is present in the classpath. 
         requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport");
        Means that the result will be true only if the class javax.mail.Transport is present in the classpath.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object that is under condition
        Parameters:
        className - the class to check
        Returns:
        the fluent condition
